tests.assumption: Pharmaceutical customers will pay 25-30% premium for organic certified papain
tests.test: Pricing survey with 5 pharmaceutical procurement managers
tests.metric: ≥4 out of 5 confirm willingness to pay $45-50/kg vs $35/kg commodity

tests.assumption: Customers will sign 3-5 year supply agreements for guaranteed quality
tests.test: Contract negotiation discussions with 3 target customers
tests.metric: ≥2 customers express interest in multi-year agreements

tests.assumption: 10-hectare farm can produce 50+ tons annually of commercial-grade papain
tests.test: Agricultural feasibility study and yield modeling
tests.metric: Expert validation of 50+ ton annual production capacity

tests.assumption: Organic certification provides meaningful differentiation vs competitors
tests.test: Competitive analysis and customer preference survey
tests.metric: ≥70% of customers value organic certification for purchasing decisions

tests.assumption: Caribbean location provides 2-4 week shipping advantage vs Asian suppliers
tests.test: Logistics analysis and shipping time comparison
tests.metric: Documented 14-28 day shipping advantage to North American customers

tests.assumption: Quality consistency can be maintained at small-batch artisan scale
tests.test: Pilot production runs with quality testing
tests.metric: ≥95% of batches meet pharmaceutical grade specifications

tests.assumption: Target customers prefer direct supplier relationships over distributors
tests.test: Customer preference interviews on procurement approach
tests.metric: ≥60% prefer direct relationships for critical ingredients

tests.assumption: Regulatory compliance costs will not exceed 10% of revenue
tests.test: Detailed cost analysis of certification and compliance requirements
tests.metric: Total compliance costs <10% of projected revenue

tests.assumption: Team can execute pharmaceutical-grade operations with current capabilities
tests.test: Skills assessment and gap analysis for quality management
tests.metric: Skills gaps identified and training/hiring plan developed

tests.assumption: Break-even achievable within 18 months at projected volumes
tests.test: Detailed financial modeling with sensitivity analysis
tests.metric: Break-even confirmed at 17-20 tons annual production

validation_summary.success_threshold: ≥80% of high priority tests must pass to proceed

week_1: Competitive analysis and organic certification value
week_3: Contract negotiation discussions with target customers
week_4: Pilot production runs and quality testing
Go/no-go decision based on test results
